Ada Wacana Jadi BUMN, TPPI Mau Diakuisisi Pertamina
06 Nov 2019, 11:19 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Foto: Danang Sugianto/detikFinance

Jakarta - Pemerintah mewacanakan mengubah status PT Trans Pacific Petrochemical Indotama (TPPI) yakni anak usaha PT Tuban Petrochemical Industries (TPI) atau Tuban Petro menjadi Badan Usaha Milik Negara (BUMN). Di tengah wacana itu, PT Pertamina (Persero) berniat untuk menambah kepemilikan di TPPI sehingga menjadi pemegang saham mayoritas.Corporate Secretary Pertamina Tajudin Noor mengatakan, saat ini tengah berkembang beberapa wacana mengenai TPPI, termasuk wacana menjadikannya sebagai BUMN. Namun, Pertamina juga mengajukan opsi untuk menambah kepemilikan saham."Ada beberapa wacana kita akan mengikuti semua apa yang diputuskan pemerintah. Cuma kan kita juga beberapa opsi terbaik karena Pertamina juga bagian pemerintah. Kita ngajuin beberapa opsi tadi lah rights issue, membeli share saham yang lain-lain yang mana terbaik," katanya di Kantor Pusat Pertamina, Jakarta, Rabu (6/11/2019).Tak secara rinci, dia mengatakan, ada beberapa pihak yang menjadi pemegang saham TPPI, di antaranya Tuban Petro yang saat ini 95% sahamnya dikuasai pemerintah, Pertamina, dan yang lain. Sementara, Pertamina memegang saham sekitar 48% di TPPI."Aku lupa kalau nggak salah 48% TPPI. Kita mau masuk lebih jauh tapi lewat TPI-nya cuma beberapa skenario ini kan masih dalam pembahasan departemen keuangan selaku pemegang saham, sama BUMN juga, tapi sudah menjadi perhatian pemerintah juga supaya bisa," katanya."Ini kan sebenarnya bahwa TPPI kilang cantik modern, petrokimia, bagus, sayang kalau nggak dimaksimalkan. Karena belum majority di sana, kita punya intensi sebagai mayoritas sehingga pengendalian secara lebih bagus di Pertamina-nya," sambungnya.Tambahnya, saat ini setidaknya ada dua opsi untuk menguasai TPPI, yakni mengambil lewat induknya TPI atau mengambil saham langsung lewat TPPI.Dia berharap, sudah ada keputusan terkait keputusan pelepasan saham ini. Soal dana, ia mengaku Pertamina sudah siap meski enggan membeberkan jumlahnya."Ada beberapa skema ini masih dalam pembicaraan semua, tapi kita harapkan di akhir tahun ini, mudah-mudahan sudah ketemu skema terbaiknya karena ini kan bicara pemerintah dan Pertamina juga," paparnya.Untuk diketahui, wacana menjadikan TPPI sebagai BUMN muncul dari Menteri Koordinator Bidang Kemaritiman dan Investasi Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan."TPPI juga tadi sudah kita usulin supaya jadi BUMN sendiri. Sudah tadi sudah diperintahkan, kita akan buat. Dan paling penting orang yang menghambat proses pembangunannya itu akan diganti," katanya usai rapat terbatas (ratas) di Istana Presiden, Jakarta, Rabu (30/10/2019). There is a discourse as a BUMN, TPPI Wants to be Acquired by Pertamina
Nov 6 2019, 11:19 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Photo: Danang Sugianto / detikFinance

Jakarta - The government is planning to change the status of PT Trans Pacific Petrochemical Indotama (TPPI), a subsidiary of PT Tuban Petrochemical Industries (TPI) or Tuban Petro to become a State-Owned Enterprise (BUMN). In the midst of the discourse, PT Pertamina (Persero) intends to increase ownership in the TPPI so that it becomes the majority shareholder. Pertamina Corporate Secretary Tajudin Noor said, currently there are a number of discourses about TPPI, including the discourse to make it a BUMN. However, Pertamina also proposes options to increase share ownership. "There are some discourses that we will follow everything the government decides. But we also have some of the best options because Pertamina is also part of the government. others which are the best, "he said at Pertamina Headquarters, Jakarta, Wednesday (11/06/2019). In detail, he said, there were several parties who were TPPI shareholders, including Tuban Petro, which is currently 95% its shares are controlled by the government, Pertamina and others. Meanwhile, Pertamina holds a 48% stake in TPPI. "I forgot, if I am not mistaken, 48% TPPI. We want to enter further, but through TPI, only a few of these scenarios are still under discussion of the finance department as shareholders, as well as SOEs, but it has also become the attention of the government so that it can be, "he said." This is actually the fact that TPPI is a modern, petrochemical, refinery that is beautiful, it's a shame if it is not maximized. "He added. Currently, there are currently at least two options for controlling TPPI, namely taking through the parent TPI or taking shares directly through TPPI. He hopes that there has been a decision regarding the decision to release this share. Regarding funds, he admitted that Pertamina was ready even though he was reluctant to disclose the amount. "There are several schemes under discussion, but we hope that by the end of this year, hopefully we will find the best scheme because this is the talk of the government and Pertamina as well," he explained. For information, the discourse to make TPPI as a BUMN comes from the Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan. will be replaced, "he said after a limited meeting (ratas) at the Presidential Palace, Jakarta, Wednesday (10/30/2019).
